meanings.sent1: She refinanced her car to get a better interest rate.
meanings.sent2: They refinanced their home to lower their monthly payments.
meanings.sent3: He refinanced his bike and felt like a financial wizard.
meanings.sent4: The idea of refinancing his student loan was a beacon of hope.
meanings.sent5: Refinancing can breathe new life into your budget.

meanings.definition: To provide new financing for something.
meanings.sent1: The bank refinanced the construction of the new school building.
meanings.sent2: The investors decided to refinance the startup for expansion.
meanings.sent3: The idea to refinance the playground equipment was a real game-changer.
meanings.sent4: Refinancing the project was like giving it a second chance to succeed.
meanings.sent5: Refinancing can be the key to unlocking growth opportunities.

meanings.definition: To obtain a new loan to replace an existing one.
meanings.sent1: She refinanced her student loan to get a lower interest rate.
meanings.sent2: They refinanced their business loan to extend the repayment period.
meanings.sent3: Refinancing the mortgage felt like hitting the financial refresh button.
meanings.sent4: The decision to refinance the car loan was a smart financial move.
meanings.sent5: Refinancing can be a lifeline when managing debt.
